sentence.Network_en: Michael Grade's persuasive powers overcame their objections.

sentence.Network_en: His arguments in favour of a new school are very persuasive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他赞成办一座新学校的理由很有说服力.

说服性沟通(persuasive communication): 在某一问题上支持特定观点的沟通,如演讲或电视广告。 耶鲁态度改变研究法(Yale attitude change approach): 研究人们在何种.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French persuasif, -ive or medieval Latin persuasivus, from persuas- 'convinced by reasoning', from the verb persuadere (see persuade)

entry.tran: 有说服力的；令人信服的
entry.def: Someone or something that is persuasive is likely to persuade a person to believe or do a particular thing.

example.ex: What do you think were some of the more persuasive arguments on the other side?...
example.tran: 你认为对方哪些观点更有说服力？

example.ex: I can be very persuasive when I want to be...
example.tran: 如果我愿意的话，我会非常有说服力的。

means.word_mean: 1. tending or intended or having the power to induce action or belief;

sentences.sentence: "the evidence is persuasive but not conclusive"

Sentence.sentence: He had read that speakers can be more persuasive if they invade the personal space of listeners, encouraging an emotional response.
How can a speaker make himself more persuasive when delivering a speech

sentences.en: The evidence was not really persuasive enough.
